CG subscribes to the belief that a single vendor for the small entrepreneur is the better approach to solving the tasks that take away from your core focus your business. Crescere Group also provides personal tax services for our business clients and others who prefer a personalized approach to getting their taxes completed. We believe that an interview process with the taxpayer is the only effective way to get the taxes completed in a timely personal way. This approach also allows the client to ask questions and review their return before submission to the IRS. Crescere Group is a new venture with experienced professionals who have practiced successfully what they are willing to provide to you the entrepreneur. Our team has a combination of over 35+ years of management experience in various industries. CG also employs advisors to assist our clients who may have specific needs that only the very experienced, hands-on professional has acquired through their career history. CG provides services to individuals and small business owners in the Dallas / Ft Worth area. The People Ron Mussett, EA is a past and current entrepreneur with an MBA and (2) BBAs [Finance and Management] + 25 years management experience. He is a recent recipient of the Aggie 100 (2008) and the University of Dallas Business Plan Award (2005). Mr. Mussett has taught Business Planning at the University of Dallas at the graduate level for several years. His expertise includes plan development, negotiations, financing, personnel management, and analysis work. He most recently operated a 48 unit franchise with 200 staff. Specifics: 18+ years of tax experience 12+ years of service industry experience 25 years in a management role Eric Bailey, EA has a Bachelor s degree in Finance. His background includes Banking, Brokerage and Accounting, including 22 years of experience in tax preparation and tax training. Eric became an Enrolled Agent in 2007 and a fellow of the National Tax Practice Institute in 2011. He is a member in good standing of the National Association of Enrolled Agents (NAEA) and the National Association of Tax Professionals (NATP). Karen Gann, RTRP has 20+ years of individual tax preparation experience and 10+ years bookkeeping experience. Karen s bookkeeping experience is with Quickbooks and specializes in the small business retail sector. Karen is a EA candidate for 2024. What we mean is simply, your tax return is not a secret. You should be able to ask questions about why your tax return is the way it is. We believe in the interview process where we ask you questions and you answer and you can ask us questions and we answer. You should participate in the review of your tax return before filing in order for you to understand why you have a refund or why you owe tax. All tax returns are completed during your appointment and you will walk out with your tax return in hand. Types of tax returns we prepare: Individual Returns (including crypto and small businesses) Business Returns Payroll Forms at the federal level Sales Tax Forms State Returns Why is Crescere a better choice? 35+ years of total experience. Personal service by appointment / no walk-ins. Personal service via drop-off / email if you can t make it in to see us. The tax staff are Enrolled Agents or Registered Return Tax Practitioners. Member in good standing with the NATP, NAEA and the BBB. Questions your tax practitioner should be able to answer: Are you certified or registered with the IRS? Starting in 2012, the IRS will require that all tax service providers meet certain minimum standards in order to provide tax practitioner services. The 3 levels will be: Annual Filing Season Program Participant (AFSP) Enrolled Agent (EA) Certified Public Accountant (CPA) How long have you or your business been doing taxes? 25+ years of combined experience. Will you provide references? Yes, you can check us out on the BBB or on Angie s List if you are a member. Education level? All of our associates are degreed professionals. Can I contact you anytime? Yes (within reason of course). We take calls almost every day of the year. Hidden costs? None. Crescere does not provide bank products like other tax services where additional fees are typically added. We do not have other erroneous fees like service fee or technology fee or e-file fee. Do you offer a guarantee on your work? If the real question is, do we pay your tax and penalty if there is an error? the answer is no. Learning Journey Maps FAQs How do Learning Journey Maps work? Learning Journey Maps are interactive tools designed to guide learners through a training program or course, providing them with a visual representation of their learning path. These maps help learners understand the overall structure and progression of the training, making it easier for them to navigate through the material and stay motivated. Here's how Learning Journey Maps typically work: Visual Representation: A Learning Journey Map presents the training program as a visual roadmap. It may be displayed as a linear timeline, a branching pathway, or any other format that best represents the learning progression. The map is usually divided into different stages or modules. Starting Point and Endpoint: The Learning Journey Map clearly indicates where learners begin their training and where they will ultimately reach at the end of the program. web copy: Oklahomans for Independent Living L O A D I N G Empowering individuals of all ages with all types of disabilities since 1985. OUR SERVICES We link individuals in Pittsburg County, Oklahoma with our five core services to help them live freely and happily. Our Services Encouraging individuals of all ages, with all types of disabilities, to increase: PERSONAL INDEPENDENCE INTEGRATION & PARTICIPATION IN WORK, SCHOOL, AND HOME EMPOWERMENT & SELF DETERMINATION I HAD NO IDEA there were so many services available near me. Thanks to Oklahomans for Independent Living, I m getting some of my favorite parts of my life back! LENA SAMUELS, MEMBER SINCE 2018 Our Mission About - Oklahomans for Independent Living L O A D I N G Mike Ward of McAlester, Oklahoma Winning Throw National Wheelchair Athletic Association (now Wheelchair Sports USA) Combined Nationals in 1985 at University of Illinois in Champagne-Urbana, Illinois. Photographer, Curt Beamer of Sports and Spokes Magazine. ABOUT US Oklahomans for Independent Living (OIL) is a nonprofit, consumer controlled, free standing organization that was formed in the spring of 1985 as the direct result of a public forum on disabilities sponsored by the City of mcAlester s Mayor s Committee on Disability Concerns and the Oklahoma Department of Human Services Rehabilitation Division. Since then, OIL has connected numerous individuals with resources they need to live freely and happily. View our Services Services - Oklahomans for Independent Living L O A D I N G Our Services Oklahomans for Independent Living links individuals with core services in Pittsburg County, as well as numerous other programs, to help them live freely and happily. Core Services Information & Referral We provide information on housing, education, health, social services, support groups and more. Independent Living Services Case Management, Transition Attendant Services Health Services Transportation Indigent Prescription Program Assistance Benefits Counseling Housing Referrals Environmental Modifications to the Home Assistive Technology, etc. Get Info Peer Counseling We connect individuals and their families with the support they need. Individual Support Groups Peer to Peer Support Groups Family Support Peer Counseling Training, etc. Get Info Individual & Systems Advocacy We teach self-advocacy techniques and give you verbal support and representation to obtain access to businesses, services, programs, and benefits. Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Surveys ADA Compliance Universal Design Review IEP Assistance IDEA Compliance Olmstead Decision Assistance Advocacy on Disability Rights and Specific Issues, etc. Get Info Independent Living Skills Training We help develop important life skills and ease transitions. Independent Living Assessments Adaptive Aid and Equipment Loan Money Management/Budget Attendant Management, Adaptive Cooking Self-Care/Activities of Daily Living Computer Literacy Lau Bach Reading Instruction Driver s License Test Preparation Job Coach Resume Preparation/Interview Skills Get Info Transition Assistance Transition from School to Workforce or Secondary Education Transition from Nursing Facility back to the Community Transition Diversion of Nursing Home Placement, etc. Get Info Other Services EMPLOYMENT Providing assistance with job search & placement, job coaching, dress for success & etiquette. CASE MANAGEMENT Case Management provided for members receiving services from the State Medicaid Community Based Waiver Program. The program provides for personal care attendant services for home chores, meal preparation, laundry, personal care assistance, errands, skilled nursing, prescriptions, home delivered meals, medical supplies and or equipment. Counties served are Atoka, Choctaw, Coal, Haskell, Hughes, Johnston, Latimer, Leflore, McIntosh, McCurtain, Okfuskee, Pittsburg and Pushmataha. ASSISTIVE TECHNOLOGY LOAN LIBRARY Loan Library of AT equipment. All durable medical equipment is donated to OIL from the community and is donated back to the community when a need has been identified. This includes disposable supply such as briefs, nutritional supplement, catheter kits, ostomy/colostomy supply, etc. LIFT EQUIPPED PUBLIC TRANSPORATION The Transportation project serves the general public in Pittsburg County. Individuals with disabilities and the elderly, and individuals that are non-ambulatory. Transportation is provided for the following trip purposes: medical, employment, nutrition, education, shopping/personal, social and recreation. The Transportation project operates as a door to door service that requires a minimum of 24- hour prior notification. O.I.L. does not run fixed routes. The hours of operation are 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, Monday through Thursday and Friday 8:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M. A fee for service charge of $2.00 per exit is charged to each passenger and $1.00 per mile outside the McAlester area. A Pandemic Response Plan has been implemented and CDC guidelines are followed. No more than 2 passengers are allowed on the bus per trip, masks are required and social distancing is practiced. COMMUNITY INTEGRATION Community, social, or recreational activities that increase the involvement of people with disabilities within their communities such as Arts and Crafts Class, Game Day, Bowling, Special Olympics Team, Lake Day, Social Cookouts, Restaurant Outings, etc. CARES ACT ASSISTANCE Housing/Living Expense: One-time financial assistance for rent/housing payments, housing and utility deposits, utility payments, fuel costs, day care assistance, misc. etc. as related to COVID-19. Food and Medical Expense: As needed financial assistance to address food insecurities, durable medical equipment or supplies as related to COVID-19, as identified and justified. School Technology: One-time financial assistance, per individual. To enable the student with a disability the needed access to technology for distance learning such as laptops, communication software or other identified technology that increases education as necessitated by COVID-19. Personal Protection Equipment (PPE): PPE Care Box Each household member will receive 2 Washable Mask, 1 box of disposable mask, 1 disposable mask carrying case, 1 box of disposable gloves, 1 personal hand sanitizer, 1 container of disinfectant wipes or 1 disinfectant cleaner and a stylus pen. Cares Act Funding ends Sept. 30, 2022, or until Funds are Exhausted. Contact Us SPIL Survey 2025-2027 - Oklahomans for Independent Living L O A D I N G SPIL Survey 2025-2027 Attached is the QR Code and the link for the draft SPIL survey for 2025-2027. There is an option to view the current SPIL draft when you access the survey. Survey Link: https://forms.gle/f9QLX263iNGVQ82P7 Learn - Oklahomans for Independent Living L O A D I N G Learn Learn about our mission and get access to other resources. Encouraging individuals of all ages, with all types of disabilities, to increase: PERSONAL INDEPENDENCE INTEGRATION & PARTICIPATION IN WORK, SCHOOL, AND HOME EMPOWERMENT & SELF DETERMINATION Kim Brownfield of Dewar, Oklahoma Winning Lift of 525 lbs at the 1989 Oklahoma Classic Powerlifting Event held in McAlester, Oklahoma. DISABILITY RESOURCE LINKS Department of Rehabilitation Services Disability and Business Technical Assistance Center Disabiliyinfo.gov National Council on Disabilities National Parent Network on Disabilities National Organization of Disabilities Oklahoma Statewide Information and Referral System Social Security Administration DRS Application for Equipment Distribution Program ADA Checklist for Polling Places Deaf Resource Library Rehabilitation Act Amendments 1998 SoonerStart (Early Intervention) U.S. Department of Justice Workforce Oklahoma ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) American Association of People with Disabilities Job Accommodation Network Join Oklahoma Information Network National Alliance for the Mentally Ill OASIS Office of Disability Concerns Oklahoma ABLE Tech Progressive Independence Special Education Resources Internet Special Education Resources It s Our Story Independent Living Research Utilization (ILRU) Special Education Teacher Resource List Disability Resource 211Oklahoma.org Administration for Community Living National Council on Independent Living (NCIL) Oklahoma Statewide Independent Living Council (SILC) Association of Programs for Rural Independent Living (APRIL) Research and Training Center on Disability (RTC) Southwest ADA Center Oklahoma People First Oklahoma Disability Law Center Oklahoma Office of Disability Concerns Oklahoma Department of Human Services Oklahoma Department of Rehabilitation Services Visitability.org Submit a Complaint (justice.gov) Employment Security Commission (oklahoma.gov) Civil Rights Enforcement | Oklahoma Attorney General The United States Social Security Administration (ssa.gov) Oklahoma s other Independent Living Centers Ability Resources TULSA Visit Website Progressive Independence NORMAN Visit Website Dynamic Independence BARTLESVILLE Visit Facebook Page Sandra Beasley Independent Living Center ENID Visit Facebook Page Events - Oklahomans for Independent Living L O A D I N G Events Click below to download our latest newsletter. June 2022 Newsletter Download Scholarship - Oklahomans for Independent Living L O A D I N G Scholarship Oklahomans for Independent Living accepts an application for the Kent Wilkins IL Scholarship beginning the 1 st of February. The educational scholarship is in memory of late Board Member, Kent Wilkins. The Scholarship is available to any High School Senior, with or without a disability, pursuing a Secondary Education or College. The Scholarship is available to a student who identifies the need for assistance with Assistive Technology, Durable Medical Equipment, Technology or Software, Misc. School Supplies, or Misc. Housing or Transportation Needs. An application is required as well as an Educational Plan and Employment Plan. Both plans must have a focus on the Independent Liv

web copy: Home Compensation Analyst Academy Compensation Analyst Academy Courses Available in August and September GO The Compensation Analyst Academy s Compensation Certificate Programs provide attendees with the fundamentals needed to successfully design and administer an organization s Compensation Program. Each of our Certification Programs concentrate on providing real life experiences through hands-on exercises for each major topic. CAA s faculty is comprised of highly experienced practitioners, consultants and educators, making this a valuable learning experience for participants. Upon successful completion of the Certification Program, graduates will receive the designation of Certified Compensation Analyst (CCA). There are several advantages of CAA s Certification Programs including: High quality compensation training with thousands of graduates Excellent reviews from past attendees Low-cost tuition at $3,850 (along with a $50 non-refundable deposit) Available in live online format Approved by national certifying authority No test is administered Recertification is not required Faculty mentoring is available to graduates The Compensation Analyst Academy also provides: Corporate Training: CAA offers high-quality real-world Compensation training from professionals currently working in Human Resources and customized to meet your organization s needs. Training can be delivered live online for a minimum of 5 participants. Contact us for more details and discount pricing for 6 or more attendees. Individualized Training: CAA supports concentrated, practical, one-to-one Compensation training sessions, with individuals receiving the full-time attention of specialized and experienced instructors. If you are in need of in-depth Compensation training, specifically designed for your individual needs then contact us for details and pricing. web copy: Richardson Compensation Consulting | Making Pay Work for You! Where Human Resources and Finance Meet Helping public sector organizations leverage salary budgets to drive results High Quality and Professional Consulting Services From compensation philosophy to salary structure design to implementation, your worries are over. Making Pay Work for You Because standard solutions do not work with unique issues. About us Richardson Compensation Consulting, LLC is a full-service consulting firm serving non-profit, public sector (municipal government, healthcare, and education), and business organizations. We pride ourselves on helping HR departments add tangible value to their organizations by providing premium compensation tools & solutions designed exclusively for the unique complexities and needs of the organization. read more What We Do Richardson Compensation Consulting, LLC specializes in helping organizations update and/or create new compensation programs that allows them to leverage their salary budgets to drive performance and results. Whether you are a school system, municipal government, government agency, healthcare provider, non-profit organization, or a business, Richardson Compensation Consulting, LLC is your trusted advisor for your compensation issues. Richardson Compensation Consulting, LLC works closely with clients to align their compensation programs with their strategic direction, so that clients can achieve their stated business objectives. Once aligned, the HR strategy comes alive and becomes the key driver for the achievement of business objectives. Whether your organization is large or small, Richardson Compensation Consulting, LLC can help. Check out our services to learn more about how pay can work for you. Services Richardson Compensation Consulting, LLC is your strategic and tactical partner for your total compensation needs, from job analysis to pay structure design to complete compensation program overhauls. Even if you simply need a pair of hands to help you complete your existing Compensation projects, Richardson Compensation Consulting, LLC can help. web copy: Sterling Sports Management Megan Khang Maja Stark Instagram Latest News Emma Talley Chosen for Kentucky Golf Hall of Fame Hartlage, Matthews Hoping Another Good Start Means a Great Finish Miguel Tabuena Nate Jones Sterling Sports Management Megan Khang Maja Stark Instagram Latest News Emma Talley Chosen for Kentucky Golf Hall of Fame Hartlage, Matthews Hoping Another Good Start Means a Great Finish Miguel Tabuena Nate Jones Mens Golf Sterling Sports Management Chad Campbell Recent Highlights: T9 - 2019 Houston Open (PGA TOUR) T13 - 2019 Knoxville Open (Korn Ferry Tour) Country: USA Personal Info: Born: Andrews, Texas Hometown: Andrews, Texas College: Midland College, University of Nevada Las Vegas Hobbies: Hunting, boating, spending time with family, watching his sons play sports Career Highlights: Winner, Viking Classic, 2007 Winner, Bob Hope Chrysler Classic, 2006 Winner, Bay Hill Invitational presented by Master Card, 2004 Winner, THE TOUR Championship presented by Coca-Cola, 2003 3-time winner on the Korn Ferry Tour all in 2001 (BUY.COM Permian Basin Open, BUY.COM Richmond Open, & BUY.COM Monterey Peninsula Classic) 3-time member of US Ryder Cup Team (2004,06,08) Bio: Before Chad Campbell had his stretch of successful seasons with wins on the PGA Tour (joined the Tour in 2001), he was in the BUY.COM Tour (now the Korn Ferry Tour). However, his exceptional play with 3 wins within one year immediately got him a battlefield promotion up to the PGA Tour partway through the season. Prior to 2000, Chad played on the third-tier NGA Hooters Tour (now the Swing Thought Tour) with even more wins. An impressive 13 wins and he was also the leading money winner 3 times. Although he has yet to win a major, Chad has come close on multiple occasions. Such as the time when he finished runner-up at the 2003 PGA Championship, T2 at the 2009 Masters after losing in a three-way playoff, and T5 at the Open Championship of 2011. Sponsors: Taylormade Jani-King Leo Barbasol Will Cannon Professional Highlights Secured Korn Ferry Tour Status for 2025 - Winner 2024 Fortinet Cup Championship (PGA TOUR Americas) - Winner 2024 Coke Dr. Pepper Open (APT) - T4 2024 BioSteel Championship (PGA TOUR Americas) - T6 2022 Jalisco Open GDL (Latinoamerica) - T6 2021 AdventHealth Championship (KFT) - T9 2019 LECOM Health Challenge (KFT) - 4 Emerald Coast Golf Tour Victories Country: USA Personal Info Born: Hilton Head, South Carolina Hometown: Hoover, Alabama College: University of Alabama at Birmingham Amateur Highlights - Back-to-back Alabama State Amateur Champion (2014, 2015) - Tied or Holds UAB Scoring Records for 18, 36 and 54 holes - T1 finish during 2014-15 season at The Goodwin (included a stellar 8-under par (62) in the 2nd round) Bio During his amateur career in Alabama, Will proved his ability to win with victories in the state high school championship and back-to-back Alabama Amateur Championships. During his time at UAB, he played for the nationally-ranked Blazers all four years and competed against some of the best talent in D1. In 2015, Will earned co-medalist honors with Stanford s Maverick McNealy at the Goodwin Invitational, a tournament that included a blistering 8-under par (62) while beating Jon Rahm, Bryson DeChambeau, Aaron Wise and many more. In his first event as a professional, Will missed Monday Qualifying for the PGA TOUR s Barbasol Championship by one shot. He then entered his second professional event on the Emerald Coast Tour and won, birdieing five of his last six holes in the final round. In 2024, he won the PGA TOUR Americas Fortinet Cup Championship where he secured Korn Ferry Tour status for 2025. To support the Children s Hospital of Alabama, Will has committed to donate five dollars for every birdie or better that he makes in his professional competitions. He ll also be actively recruiting matching donations through his website, social media and personal appearances. Gary Christian Professional Highlights - Winner 2009 Northeast Pennsylvania Classic (KFT) - Winner 2011 Mylan Classic (KFT) - T10 2012 RBC Canadian Open (PGA TOUR) - 30 victories on mini tours - Competed on the PGA TOUR between 2012-2014 - Competed on the Korn Ferry Tour for 12 season - Commentator and Studio Analyst for Golf Channel, PGA Tour - Live and SKY Sports UK - Global Ambassador for Golf Traveller (UK) - PGA of America Golf Instructor in Birmingham, AL Amateur Highlights - 1994 All-SEC Team at Auburn University - 1995 All-American Scholar at Auburn University Country: England Personal Info: Born: August 7, 1971 Turned Professional: 1998 College: Auburn University Bio: A former 40-year-old rookie on the PGA TOUR and two-time winner on the Korn Ferry Tour turned broadcaster, Gary Christian s immense knowledge of the game dates back to his native England, where his love and knowledge of the game was formed on the heathlands of Surrey and the coastal links. After a career that spanned over two decades and was cut short by a knee injury, Gary continues to be engaged in the game he loves via broadcasting. Gary now can be found at golf tournaments working for PGA Tour Live, the Golf Channel, NBC Sports, and ESPN. He is also an Ambassador for Golf Traveller (UK), hosting golf trips worldwide. Additionally, he instructs amateurs and professionals on a regular basis, with an emphasis on short game and course management. He resides in Birmingham, Alabama and is married to his wife Kimberly and is the father of two boys. Russ Cochran Career Highlights: PGA TOUR Highlights - Winner 1991 Centel Western Open 58 Career Top 10s PGA TOUR Champions Highlights - Winner 2013 SAS Championship Winner 2013 Principal Charity Classic Winner 2011 The Senior Open Championship Winner 2010 SAS Championship Winner 2010 Posco E&C Songdo Championship 58 Career Top 10s 220 out of 227 Career Cuts Made Bio: As a Kentucky native, Ross Cochran played collegiate golf for the University of Kentucky. After a successful college career, Russ turned professional and joined the PGA TOUR in 1979 and was later inducted into the University of Kentucky Hall of Fame in 2018. Russ was the only left-handed player on the PGA TOUR for nearly the first ten years of his professional career, and to this day he remains one of the only naturally-left-handed professionals to win on the PGA TOUR. In 1991, Russ won the Centel Western Open and recorded two second-place finishes and one third-place finish. He ended the year tenth on the money list. Today, he has five Champions Tour wins on his resume and continues to compete amongst the world s best. Off the course, Russ enjoys spending time with his wife, Jackie, and their four children. His son, Case, and nephew, Rick III, are professional golfers as well. Country: USA Joshua Creel Professional Highlights: - Winner 2021 Utah Championship (KFT) - 2nd 2021 Live and Work in Maine Open (KFT) - 2nd 2019 Utah Championship (KFT) - T2 - 2025 Veritex Bank Championship (KFT) - T4 2019 Ellie Mae Classic (KFT) - T5 2013 Dakota Dunes Open (PGA TOUR Canada) - T13 - 2025 BMW Charity Pro-Am (KFT) - T16 2022 Barracuda Championship (PGA TOUR) - 8 Top-10 Korn Ferry Tour Finishes - Earned PGA TOUR Card in 2021 Amateur Highlights: - Led Central High School in Cheyenne, WY to four consecutive state titles - DII All-American at University of Central Oklahoma - NCAA DII Individual Champion, 2012 - 2012 Division II Arnold Palmer Award Recipient - Winner 2010 Oklahoma Golf Association Stroke Play Championship (72-65-69) Country: United States Personal Info: Born: March 2, 1990 Turned Professional: 2012 College: University of Central Oklahoma Bio: Josh Creel is a Wyoming native and professional golfer who currently plays on the Korn Ferry Tour. Raised in Wyoming, he is only the second golfer ever from the state to obtain a PGA TOUR Card. After leading his high school team to four consecutive state titles, Josh attended the University of Central Oklahoma where he won a DII National Championship, was a DII All-American, and was named DII Arnold Palmer Award. Josh turned professional in 2012 and went on to win the Korn Ferry Tour s 2021 Utah Championship, a victory that catapulted him to the PGA TOUR in 2021. Off the course, Josh is a dedicated husband and father to his wife, Alex, and son, Colt. He loves to hunt, fish, and spend quality time with his family where they reside in Edmond, Oklahoma. Sponsors: Escalade Folds of Honor Longhorn Investments Taco John s Titleist Turtleson Alex Fourie Career Highlights: - #1 One-Arm Golfer in the United States - Winner 2021 North American One-Armed Golfers Association Spring Championship - 2nd - 2021 Georgia State Golf Association Adaptive Open - 2022 and 2023 U.S. Adaptive Open - Level 1 PGA Golf Instructor & Associate Member - Level 1 Certified for the Titleist Performance Institute - Pursuing Path to Full Class A PGA Membership - Founder of Single Hand Golf Personal Info: Born: 1992 in Zvenyhorodka, Ukraine Residence: Birmingham, AL Bio: Alex Fourie was born in Zvenyhorodka, Ukraine. He was born with one arm and a cleft lip and palate which may have been due to lingering radiation effects from the Chernobyl disaster a few years before his birth. After spending his first seven years in orphanages, he was adopted in 1999, weighing only 35 pounds and having soup for nearly every meal. His parents put a golf club in his hand the first week he arrived in the U.S. He developed a passion for teaching golf, particularly to those with physical disabilities or limitations. He later founded Single Hand Golf, with a mission to inspire kids with adaptive needs to love, learn and grow in golf. His handicap is 0.6, making him the best one-armed golfer in the country. He is also a father to a beautiful baby girl, Lila. Sponsors: From The Sidewalk Live Forever Golf Mizuno PING Scotty Cameron Titleist YETI Jim Herman Career Highlights: Winner 2020 Wyndham Championship - Closing 36-hole score of 124 (61-63) Winner 2019 Barbasol Championship Winner 201

web copy: Home - Brightstar Consulting, LLC Welcome To Brightstar Consulting, LLC HR Training and Consulting for Small Businesses Welcome To Brightstar Consulting, LLC HR Training and Consulting for Small Businesses Expert HR Training and Consulting to Solve Your Business Challenges At Brightstar, we re on a mission to help businesses and professionals in Central Ohio and surrounding areas succeed. As a premier training, development, and human resource consulting choice, we understand the challenges small businesses face when it comes to HR. That s why we offer expert guidance and practical solutions to everyday HR problems, with or without an on-site HR presence. Learn More Benefits of Working with Brightstar Consulting, LLC At Brightstar Consulting, LLC, we offer interactive, engaging training that encourages dialogue and focuses on the learner. We are a minority, female and veteran-owned business bringing diverse perspectives and experiences to our clients. Our customers receive expert guidance, personalized solutions, and training that focuses on achieving their goals and desired outcomes. Our Services Certified for Excellence: Demonstrating Our Commitment to Diversity and Professional Development We are proud to hold multiple certifications that showcase our dedication to providing top-notch services. Our Minority Business Enterprise (MBE), Woman Owned Business Enterprise (WBE), Veteran Business Enterprise (VBE), and Society for Human Resources Management (SHRM-CP) certifications not only demonstrate our expertise in the field of human resources, but also our unwavering commitment to excellence, diversity, and professional development. With these certifications, we aim to showcase our team s skills and qualifications, ensuring that we offer the best possible solutions to our clients. We are also certified by the National Veteran-Owned Business Association (NaVOBA) and Accredited by the Better Business Bureau (BBB) since 10/14/2020, meeting BBB s Standards of Trust. Working Together for Success We work with a diverse range of clients, from Executive Directors, Directors, Educators, Administrators, CEOs, and HR Professionals to Business Professional. We are committed to helping our clients achieve their goals and take the next step in their careers. Whatever your professional development needs are, we are here to help you reach your full potential and achieve success. This training will provide tools and tips to help you succeed in your job search. Take your journey to federal employment to the next level. Join us for these interactive training sessions. Learn More Get Our Free Guide: Learn How to Obtain Federal Employment If you don t have time to attend our training, our guide will give you everything you need to know to apply for federal positions. Download Purchase Our Inspirational Book and Empower Your Path to Success In her book, Think Veterans First: Pushing through the Pandemic for the Win , Regina Rembert, CEO/Founder of Brightstar Consulting, offers a fresh perspective on overcoming adversity, drawing upon her experience as a veteran and business leader to provide actionable strategies for success in challenging times. The theme of the book is WIN! W-work, I-intentionally involve others, N-never give up! The book is available for purchase directly on our website and is a must-read for anyone looking to stay resilient and driven in the face of difficulty or adversity. Shop Now Women Who Win! Networking Group Inspired by the principles outlined in her book, Regina Rembert has developed a series of women s networking groups called Women Who Win!. Women in the Columbus and surrounding areas are invited to come together to discuss topics related to WIN principles Work putting in the work and pushing thru challenges, Internally Involving Others or Networking strategies, and Never-give-up attitudes. These events take place in various locations around Columbus, including Co-Hatch locations, Polaris, Westerville, and Easton. With support from ECDI, local banks such as U.S. Bank, First Merchants Bank and The Union Bank Company sponsor each event. The events take place on Wednesday evenings from 5:30 to 7 pm, which we call #winningwednesdays. Attendees can register for events through Eventbrite and are guaranteed to connect with like-minded women who are committed to pushing past obstacles and achieving their goals. Join us and meet women who inspire! Learn More Contact The Experts at Brightstar Consulting Get in touch with the human resources experts at Brightstar Consulting to take your business or career to the next level. web copy: Home - ModernThink Helping colleges and universities become better places to work and learn. workplace quality Organizational culture employee engagement Higher Education Surveys ModernThink offers a number of fully customizable survey instruments within higher education, each with unparalleled benchmarking capabilities that range from as broad as Carnegie Classification to as specific as aspirational peers for a given college. View Surveys Great Colleges Program The Great Colleges to Work For program was designed to recognize colleges that have been successful in creating great workplaces and to further research and understand the factors, dynamics and influences that have the most impact on organizational culture in higher education. View Programs Who We Are - ModernThink Who We Are Our mission and passion are helping colleges and universities become better places to work and learn. Founded in 2004, ModernThink is a management consulting firm with particular expertise in workplace quality, organizational culture, and employee engagement. As a research and consulting leader in workplace quality, ModernThink has been involved with over 50 city, state and regional Best Places to Work initiatives. ModernThink has surveyed over 1,200 colleges and universities through the Great Colleges to Work For program and in our work with individual institutions and systems. We have a deep understanding of the challenges currently facing leaders in academe and substantial expertise providing data-driven solutions. Our mission and passion are helping colleges and universities become better places to work and learn. In partnership with The Chronicle of Higher Education, ModernThink co-founded The Great Colleges to Work For program in 2008 which ModernThink now operates independently and administers annually. This program surveys hundreds of thousands of employees at over two hundred institutions simultaneously every spring. This process includes both a survey of each college s employees as well as an audit of their people practices. The combination of the two assessments allows us to see what programs, benefits and approaches are working on the top colleges each year as well as the pain points that keep institutions from thriving. We have worked with institutions in good times, and bad, and have become adept at supporting institutions in the midst of transition and/or crisis. We have conducted assessments for institutions exploring mergers and consolidations; collected data to inform large scale change including new shared services and/or budgeting models; and supported presidents, chancellors, and provosts at the outset of their tenures and during challenging times. What We Do - ModernThink What We Do We have been working with colleges and universities for over a decade, helping schools understand where they are on the continuum of workplace quality and then engage in data-based strategic planning to enhance academic and operational excellence. ModernThink s higher education focus and experience separates us from the crowd of organizations who routinely deploy culture/climate assessments. We know that employee engagement surveys designed for corporate environments do not capture the structures, processes, and challenges of faculty and staff within higher education. We have specifically designed the ModernThink Higher Education Insight Survey to measure the organizational dynamics and competencies unique to institutions of higher education. We also know that the workplace experience of faculty and staff ultimately impacts the student experience. Our ModernThink Higher Education Insight Survey , used in and outside of the Great Colleges to Work For program, measures the dynamics and competencies unique to higher education. For those institutions that survey on a regular cycle, the survey reports provide a key measure of progress. Institutions rely on this data for strategic planning, accreditation self-studies, and leadership team transitions. Our unique benchmarking provides an external perspective on how your institution measures up in a variety of areas including being recognized as a top college for workplace excellence. ModernThink s speaking engagements within higher education include but are not limited to the following: ACE (American Council on Education) NACUBO (National Association of College and University Business Officers) AAC&U (Association of American Colleges and Universities) CUPA-HR National CUPA-HR-Regionals NCCI (National Consortium for Continuous Improvement in Higher Education) The Rural Community College Alliance AIR Forum Our core competency is helping institutions assess and then improve their culture and climate. During the assessment phase, we gather feedback from key stakeholders including institutional leadership, staff, faculty, and students. We then provide detailed feedback on our findings including: Summarizing and synthesizing key themes, patterns and trends Highlighting strengths and weaknesses Uncovering potential risks Discussing what peers do when faced with similar challenges. Our ultimate goals are to recommend a path forward based on your institutions specific results, start strategic planning to address key areas and help you implement best practices to improve your culture. Survey - ModernThink Higher Education Surveys Overview Faculty & Staff Engagement Survey Exit Survey Student Insight Survey Leadership Transition Survey Systems & Consortia Overview ModernThink offers a number of fully customizable survey instruments within higher education, each with unparalleled benchmarking capabilities that range from as broad as Carnegie Classification to as specific as aspirational peers for a given college. Our database contains survey information from more than 1,200 institutions ranging from small liberal arts colleges to large research universities as well as both 4-year and 2-year colleges. The depth of data at our disposal, coupled with the agility of our proprietary survey engine, allow us to provide uniquely tailored client solutions and high-touch customer service and project management. Our surveys are designed to gather, summarize and synthesize feedback from a wide variety of campus stakeholders and then to help leaders understand key themes, trends and patterns so that they can make data-driven decisions. Their analysis is enhanced by tapping into ModernThink s unrivaled database of workplace metrics and best practices so that they can see how they compare to peers as well as how others are dealing with many of the same challenges that they face. Faculty & Staff Engagement Survey The ModernThink Higher Education Insight Survey is specifically designed to measure the organizational dynamics and competencies unique to institutions of higher education and is used as the principal assessment tool in the annual Great Colleges to Work For program. The survey instrument measures the extent to which faculty and staff are involved and engaged in your institution and ultimately, the health of the culture and quality of the workplace experience. The survey statements in the ModernThink Higher Education Insight Survey themselves, and the associated scales/dimensions, are derived not just from ModernThink research but also from existing employment engagement research. Insights into the drivers, competencies, and behaviors that influence employee engagement from The Conference Board, the Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM), The Baldrige Foundation and more were all considered in the development and ongoing maintenance of our instrument. Within higher education there are structures and dynamics that are unique to higher education , for example, the experience of shared governance; the dynamics between faculty and staff; and the perceived understanding and balance of an institution s mission of teaching, research, and service. Such dynamics are rarely considered in generalized employee engagement research. However, given our understanding of how important these elements are within Higher Education we have developed survey items that specifically address these critical topics. ModernThink regularly convenes a blue-ribbon panel of experts and professionals from across higher education to solicit input and review the ModernThink Higher Education Insight Survey to ensure that it remains current and reflective of today s academic workplace. The most recent panel was convened in 2021 to address workplace changes influenced by the Covid-19 Pandemic. The core ModernThink Higher Education Insight Survey includes 55 belief statements and 5 Faculty Experience statements, intended for Faculty and Adjunct Faculty respondents. The instrument utilizes a five-point agreement scale (Strongly Agree, Agree, Sometimes Agree/Sometimes Disagree, Disagree, Strongly Disagree), along with a Not Applicable response option. The core survey instrument also includes a 20-item benefits satisfaction component, two open-ended questions, and eight demographic questions (e.g., Gender, Age, Race/Ethnicity, Job Classification,School/College and Department/Division). The belief statements of the ModernThink Higher Education Insight Survey are typically grouped and reported out in a series of dimensions and indices (Note: we use the term dimensions in lieu of scales, the composition of the dimensions is determined by confirmatory factor analysis). Why Use The Survey Compare your campus climate to that of peer institutions by size, region, Carnegie, and more Gather employee insights on a new initiative, project, or practice Develop a strategic plan or evaluate the effectiveness of strategic plan implementation Fulfill accreditation or funding requirements Measure campus engagement before, during, or after a change in leadership Assess differences in campus climate across a state or regional college system About the Innovation Index In partnership with NCCI (the Network for Change and Continuous innovation in Higher Education)

title: Partner
web copy: Greenwood Ohlund CPAs - Seattle's Best Accountants Skip to main content Supportive Responsive Collaborative Innovative Changing the Face of Accounting Expert Guidance, Exceptional Service Established in 1971 in Seattle, Washington, we are a full-service public accounting firm. What We Do Reliable Solutions, Real Results Tax Services As your tax advisors we provide proactive, year-round tax planning that aligns with your business and personal financial goals. Audit & Assurance Experience and efficiency provides your organization with a uniquely enjoyable audit or assurance engagement. CFO & Accounting Services Accounting is meant to be boring, leave that to us. We partner with you to help build your strategic financial vision and value. Dedicated Professionals Years of Proven Experience Diverse Services and Teams Who We Are Experts Committed to Your Success We build long-lasting relationships. Greenwood Ohlund is dedicated to the growth and success of our clients. Our Team Recent News Latest Updates and Insights from Greenwood Ohlund July 02, 2025 Is Your Bookkeeping Holding You Back? 5 Signs You Need CPA Bookkeeping Services June 01, 2025 5/20/2025: Washington State Tax Changes May 28, 2025 Washington Capital Gains Tax: A Holistic Tax Strategy Approach Read more FAQ Frequently Asked Questions 01 Tax Services What are the benefits of annual tax planning with a tax professional? Without expert advice, it s easy to miss out on various tax benefits, which could lead to higher payments than necessary. By understanding the deductions, credits, and exemptions available to you, we can make the most of your tax situation. Short-term, effective tax planning can mean more money in your pocket. Long-term, tax planning can positively influence many aspects of life, from funding your children s education to ensuring your financial stability in retirement. If you haven t started tax planning yet, there s no better time than now to begin. Taking these steps early can set you up for financial success both now and in the future. How long will it take to get my refund? If your return is e-filed, it usually takes up to 21 days for the IRS to process your refund. Direct deposit is the fastest way to get your refund. If you choose a refund by paper check, it will be mailed to the address on your return. If you would like to check the status of your refund, you may check on the IRS website here . How do I send my tax documents to you? We use SafeSend as a one-stop shop for gathering client tax documents, distributing sensitive information, and collecting e-signatures for various authorization forms. After you are established as a client, we will send you an invite to our Client Portal via SafeSend. Here, you may securely upload any documents that we might need to file your tax return. If you do not have a portal, you can upload your documents here . How long will it take to prepare my tax return? We need at least six weeks to prepare and review a tax return before it is ready for you to sign. Preparation time depends on the complexity of the return, your timeline in getting us any additional information we request, and the time of year. February through April and August through October are our busiest times of the year. I have another tax related inquiry. Visit our Key Tax Considerations page for more information. 02 Audit & Assurance Is every nonprofit organization required to have an audit? In the state of Washington, charitable organizations with more than three million in annual gross revenue, averaged over three preceding years, are required to obtain an independent financial statement audit. Not-for-profit organizations may also be required to obtain an audit as a result of requirements in your bylaws, grant terms, debt covenants, or other conditions imposed by a third party. What is the difference between an audit and a review? An audit provides reasonable assurance that the financial statements do not contain any material misstatements. This is achieved through inquiries of management, analytical procedures, and substantive tests of transactions on a sample basis. A review provides limited assurance that material changes are not needed for the financial statements to be in accordance with generally accepted accounted principles (GAAP) or other applicable basis of accounting. Review engagements primarily involve inquiries of management and analytical procedures applied to management s financial data. What is a Single Audit and who is required to undergo one? A Single Audit is an audit of compliance with major federal award program requirements and with certain provisions of laws, regulations, contracts, and grant agreements. Single Audits are required for organizations that expend $750,000 or more of federal award funds during their fiscal year. For fiscal years ending September 30, 2025, and later, this threshold increases to $1,000,000. Who is required to undergo an employee benefit audit? A 401(k) plan or 403(b) plan generally needs an audit if it has 100 or more participants with account balances on the first day of the plan year. This is known as the large plan threshold. However, there is an exception to this rule called the 80/120 rule . Plans with between 80 and 120 participants with account balances can avoid an audit if they filed as a small plan in the previous year. If you are unsure whether or not your retirement plan needs an audit please don t hesitate to reach out to our assurance team for assistance. 03 CFO & Accounting Services How can CAS benefit my business? CAS offers several benefits, such as cost savings by eliminating the need to hire full-time accounting staff, access to specialized expertise, improved financial reporting and compliance, and the ability to focus on growing your business rather than managing day-to-day accounting tasks. What accounting software does GO typically use for CAS? Common accounting software platforms used includes QuickBooks Online, QuickBooks, Bill.com, and multiple payroll platforms (ADP, Paychex, Gusto, Paycom). What should I expect from the GO CAS department in terms of reporting and communication? At GO, we customize financial reporting to meet your specific needs, typically delivering reports between the 15th and 20th of each month. We also schedule regular communication, either monthly or quarterly, to review financial performance, address any concerns, and plan for future goals. Additionally, our team is committed to responding to emails within one business day. Our Clients Contact Ready to GO? Get in touch to schedule a free consultation and start achieving your financial goals. " * " indicates required fields Greenwood Ohlund CPAs - Seattle's Best Accountants Skip to main content Supportive Responsive Collaborative Innovative Changing the Face of Accounting Expert Guidance, Exceptional Service Established in 1971 in Seattle, Washington, we are a full-service public accounting firm. CFO & Accounting Services Accounting is meant to be boring, leave that to us. We partner with you to help build your strategic financial vision and value. Dedicated Professionals Years of Proven Experience Diverse Services and Teams Who We Are Experts Committed to Your Success We build long-lasting relationships. Greenwood Ohlund is dedicated to the growth and success of our clients. Our Team Recent News Latest Updates and Insights from Greenwood Ohlund July 02, 2025 Is Your Bookkeeping Holding You Back? 5 Signs You Need CPA Bookkeeping Services June 01, 2025 5/20/2025: Washington State Tax Changes May 28, 2025 Washington Capital Gains Tax: A Holistic Tax Strategy Approach Read more FAQ Frequently Asked Questions 01 Tax Services What are the benefits of annual tax planning with a tax professional? Without expert advice, it s easy to miss out on various tax benefits, which could lead to higher payments than necessary. By understanding the deductions, credits, and exemptions available to you, we can make the most of your tax situation. Short-term, effective tax planning can mean more money in your pocket. Long-term, tax planning can positively influence many aspects of life, from funding your children s education to ensuring your financial stability in retirement. If you haven t started tax planning yet, there s no better time than now to begin. Taking these steps early can set you up for financial success both now and in the future. How long will it take to get my refund? If your return is e-filed, it usually takes up to 21 days for the IRS to process your refund. Direct deposit is the fastest way to get your refund. If you choose a refund by paper check, it will be mailed to the address on your return. If you would like to check the status of your refund, you may check on the IRS website here . How do I send my tax documents to you? We use SafeSend as a one-stop shop for gathering client tax documents, distributing sensitive information, and collecting e-signatures for various authorization forms. After you are established as a client, we will send you an invite to our Client Portal via SafeSend. Here, you may securely upload any documents that we might need to file your tax return. If you do not have a portal, you can upload your documents here . How long will it take to prepare my tax return? We need at least six weeks to prepare and review a tax return before it is ready for you to sign. Preparation time depends on the complexity of the return, your timeline in getting us any additional information we request, and the time of year. February through April and August through October are our busiest times of the year. I have another tax related inquiry. Visit our Key Tax Consider

web copy: New Book: How to Win in the Government Market Here are shortcuts to my seven books... CLICK HERE to learn about my three government contractor marketing and project management books including FREE Flipbook versions of How to Win in the Government Market (2nd edition) co-authored with Mark Amtower and The Essential Guide to Managing a Government Project co-authored with myself! CLICK HERE to learn about my four personal growth and Buddhist-themed books -- all four also available to read on any device as FREE flipbooks. CLICK HERE to watch my thirteen music and narrated YouTube videos. About Mike Lisagor (Me!) I'm an author & columnist, a retired government contractor marketing & project management expert and a blues/jazz musician. Once upon a time, I was an aerospace and IT engineer, and then an industry executive. I finally relinquished his suit and tie to start a consulting company, Celerity Works , in 1999 where I advised over 500 company and government executives and managers. Now retired (from work), I recently founded GiveTeensHope.org to encourage young people in these difficult times and to promote my latest book, Eleven Life Lessons for Teenagers (& Everyone Else) . which is now a free Flipbook. I spend most of my time speaking to teenagers, writing essays and books, raising money with (and for) my wife of 55 years for MS research and services, creating graphic art, attending Buddhist discussion meetings, seeing a wonderful therapist, playing piano, harmonica and singing with local musicians, and weather permitting, hiking. My wife and I live on a beautiful island in the Pacific Northwest. More stuff about me! Based on the presentation I've given to over 3,000 high school students, Eleven Life Lessons for Teenagers (and Everyone Else ) is a 50-page guide (now also a FREE Flipbook) filled with wisdom and insight for teens and parents who're looking for help responding to their teenager's concerns. Intertwined with an honest sharing of my own personal challenges are the answers to eleven of teen s most pressing questions including making a difference in the world, dealing with depression and anxiety, making mistakes, getting bad grades, improving relationships, taking risks, and finding hope in a challenging world. My solitary endeavors during COVID isolation (including playing music withour band, Good Karma Blues, in my garage) culminated in four published books: The Essential Guide to Managing a Government Projects and How to Win in the Government Market (with Mark Amtower), The Muse Within: Unlocking Spiritual Growth Through the Eyes of 34 Writers, Artists, Musicians and Philosophers and My 50 Years of Buddhist Practice , I'm also the author of How to Develop a Winning SBIR Proposal (with Eric Adolphe). I've produced numerous webinars (many are still on YouTube!) and written several hundred magazine columns, articles, and blog posts on a variety of business and Buddhist-related topics. I'm also the author of Romancing the Buddha (fourth edition) which I adapted and performed as a successful one-man show that can be watched on YouTube . My nature photographs have appeared in the Boston Globe, Bainbridge Island Magazine, Living Buddhism as well as in several galleries. My latest project utilized Chat-AI and Photoshop to create a series of ten posters for the lobby of New Motion Physcal Therapy. Links to my books Read about all my books at BooksByMike.org including six free Flipbook versions. How to Win in the Government Market (with Mark Amtower) The Essential Guide to Managing a Government Project . How to Develop a Winning Small Business Innovation Proposal (with Eric Adolphe) The Enlightened Manager Romancing the Buddha , also a successful one-man show on YouTube. Elk Jay M. Kelley III John P. O Neil Phillip A. Kuri R. Our firm works on a contingency fee basis and charges nothing upfront. Ohio Personal Injury Attorneys Injuries are never planned. They leave people with large bills, loss of income and a challenging living situation. At Elk + Elk, we understand the sudden, severe impact an unexpected accident can have on your life, and we want to help. You re not alone through the stress and hardship. We can help you get through the aftermath of an accident, lending you emotional support while securing the compensation you need to make a full recovery. If you or a loved one has been seriously injured in a car accident , contact us today to discuss your situation. The consequences of an injury shouldn t determine your family s livelihood. We will protect your interests and help you get the compensation you need to move on. How we can help you Our experienced lawyers have more than 40 years of personal injury experience to successfully represent you or your loved one. We have multiple offices throughout Ohio to conveniently assist you with your legal needs. Our offices in Cincinnati, Cleveland, Columbus, and Dayton have the resources necessary to craft a compelling case on your behalf. We will stand by you every step of the way, fighting for a resolution and maintaining open communication and transparency throughout the legal process. We will not charge you for our services unless we win. Our firm operates on a contingency fee basis, with no up-front costs. Why Do You Need a Personal Injury Lawyer? After a serious personal injury accident in Ohio, you may be dealing with significant pain and suffering, stress, confusing paperwork, lost wages, and other hardships because of your accident. Hiring a lawyer can immediately give you mental and emotional relief. Your Ohio personal injury lawyer can take over complex processes such as documenting your injuries and filing a civil claim in Ohio while you focus on healing. Unlike an insurance claims adjuster, your attorney will work for you. Your personal injury lawyer will do everything in his or her power to earn you the compensation you need. "Absolutely excellent! Stayed on top of my case and made sure I was informed. Very impressive, knowledgeable, courteous and polite. I would recommend to anyone including family!" Richard Client Testimonial: Medical Malpractice Client Testimonial: Auto Accident Client Testimonial: Wrongful Death view more client testimonials Serious Lawyers For Serious Injuries view more case results why choose our law firm? When you hire Elk + Elk, your problem is our number one concern. We will out-work, out-hustle and give every ounce of energy to make certain you get what you deserve and need. birth injury $9,800,000 Our client s 3-year-old daughter suffered brain damage at birth as a result of Robinson Memorial Hospital s negligence. wrongful death $4,375,000 Our 77-year-old client suffered burns on over 40% of their body after a propane tank exploded, eventually succumbing to injuries. medical malpractice $10,000,000 Our client in Lucas County suffered paralysis as a result of negligence during surgery to correct severe scoliosis. car accident $7,100,000 Recovery for an Ohio woman who was rear-ended by an SUV at a high rate of speed on an Indiana highway. She suffered traumatic injuries that prevented her from continuing her career. Making meaningful changes in the lives of our clients We Can Help You in All Areas of Personal Injury Elk + Elk is proud to represent the people of Ohio across many personal injury practice areas. Our law firm offers tailored solutions to clients after a range of accidents and injuries, from spinal cord injuries to loss of limb. Auto accidents . Motor vehicle accidents are some of the most common causes of serious injuries and deaths in Ohio. Elk + Elk can investigate your crash, identify the at-fault party, gather evidence, and help you pursue fair compensation. Medical malpractice . Medical malpractice is the negligent lack of appropriate care from a physician or other healthcare professional, resulting in patient injuries or death. Our Ohio medical malpractice attorneys know how to bring physicians to justice. Birth injuries . Birth injuries are a type of medical malpractice that can injure mother and child. They include brain damage and related conditions such as cerebral palsy. Our Ohio birth injury lawyers have experience handling these claims and achieving positive outcomes. Workers compensation . An accident at work can leave you with confusing legal paperwork. We can help you identify the best action to take to obtain compensation from an insurance company, your employer, or a product manufacturer. Product defects . A defective auto part, appliance, children s toy, drug, or medical device could cause serious injuries. We can help you file a product liability claim in Ohio. Premises defects . If you suffered a slip and fall, swimming pool accident, dog bite, or other premises-related accident, we can help you go up against the careless property owner. Wrongful death. Wrongful death is a claim against a person who can be held liable for a death. If you lost a loved one due to the fault of another person, you may be eligible for compensation. Our Ohio personal injury lawyers are here for victims in their times of need. If you do not see your practice area here, contact us to discuss your individual needs. How much does a personal injury attorney cost? At Elk + Elk, our injury attorneys operate on a contingency fee basis. We only charge attorney s fees if we win a financial award on the client s behalf. If we do win the case, we take a pre-agreed upon percentage of the settlement or verdict we collect. We never bill the client directly or take our fees out of pocket. We believe in giving everyone equal access to justice. Contact us today Suffering a serious personal injury can completely change your life. Let our lawyers walk you through the legal process and explain your rights and options based on the circumstances of your case. We can give you peace of mind through information about how to pursue compensation. Our personal injury attorneys can fight aggressively to secure a fair and full compensation award for you and your loved ones. Learn more during a free, confidential consultation near you in Ohio, or read some of our client testimonials and reviews on Google for more information. Call (800) ELK-OHIO to schedule your consultation today, or contact us online. Catastrophic accidents can happen at any moment. The pain and suffering that follow can affect an entire family. Learn More Easy Tax Credit Platform in 90 Seconds Learn More Billions of Dollars Go Unclaimed Each Year Due to Excessive Paperwork Learn More Are You Leaving Money on the Table Every Year? Learn More McKenzie Chase Management (MCM) and the MCM Tax Credit Programs McKenzie Chase Management s history is rooted in the Work Opportunity Tax Credit (WOTC) program, drawing on 40 years of experience. Additional employer tax credit programs are supported to help clients earn beneficial tax credits captured in the hiring process. The Employee Retention Credit, Empowerment Zone, Indian Employment Credit and State/Local tax credits are researched and supported for you as simplified programs that are easy to implement for every size business platform you might have in place. We focus on hiring incentive programs with systems that provide maximum flexibility, ease of implementation and maximum results. Client Testimonies Tiny Changes, Big Paycheck! Gain access to the same process that Fortune 500 companies use to save hundreds of thousands of dollars each year. Here s what owners, accountants, and HR directors of client businesses have said: Huge savings, huge savings. For every dollar that we save MCM only cost us pennies, so it s a huge benefit for us and to save thousands of dollars at the end of the year. Investor, Casual Dining Establishment. You know with Mike, with McKenzie Chase, I feel totally comfortable just giving Mike the reigns so I don t have to deal with it, one less thing to work with our hotels is great, so yeah its been really nice. And having that personal relationship, and just knowing that I can call and I can talk to the person already handling my company s program. Regional Controller, Hotel Management Firm. I would say MCM is very responsive. You know most of the time he s so proactive he didn t have to respond to anything I m asking because he s already there, giving me what I needed. Chief Financial Officer, Fruit Grower and Shipper. You can do a lot of little things in a mediocre way? Or you can concentrate on what you re good at. And, I want to concentrate on what I m good at and and together we make a good team. Controller, Security Services Firm. Total Service from MCM provides you everything you need to maximize your hiring incentives, and minimize your efforts. Before you even know what you need MCM has it for you at your fingertips. Tax Credit Advisors at McKenzie Chase Management discover which tax credits would be most profitable for your organization to pursue; contact MCM today for your complimentary evaluation. 40 Years of Tax Credit Services McKenzie Chase Management started in 1982 supporting the Targeted Job Tax Credit (TJTC) in Seattle and the Northwest. The Work Opportunity Tax Credit program (WOTC) was introduced on October 1, 1996, to provide tax incentives for employers who hire individuals from specific target groups. People from these target groups have been identified by the U.S. government as having historically high unemployment rates. After introducing the WOTC program to our clients in 1996, McKenzie Chase Management went online, introducing Electronic Tax Credits in 2009 with a simple, fast, tax credit system that applicants could complete in less than 2 minutes, without the need for help pages or tutorials by anyone. Through WOTC, employers can earn a tax credit per qualified employee; these tax credits can be applied to employers income taxes, reducing the amount they owe the IRS. Including online screening for tax credits. Currently, McKenzie Chase Management offers the MCM Online System free to clients including a WOTC Hub for multi-location clients. In addition to the electronic online systems on-paper tax credit programs are supported with free pre-addressed envelopes, online secure server support, and monthly activity reports. Tax Credits McKenzie Chase Management offers a suite of tax credit and employer incentive services designed to save your company money with little effort on your part. In many cases, you can enjoy savings without changing company business practices. Additional employer tax credit programs are supported to help clients earn beneficial tax credits captured in the hiring process.
